title: Graph-Based Perceptual Segmentation of Stereo Vision 3D Images at Multiple Abstraction Levels

author: Rodrigo Moreno, Tarragona University, Rovira i Virgili

segmentation: OK, my name is Rodrigo Moreno.
My professors are Garcia and Dominic push with the low Abd University an autonomous in University of Madrid.
Our work is called graph based perceptual segmentation, office television 3D meshes at multiple abstraction levels.
Our problem is to segment eight through the matches, so the problem can be seen as an input.

That is our cloud very noisy, points in 3D, acquired through service and an hour help output is a set of non overlapping or genius regions at multiple abstraction levels and our restriction is to minimize the number of parameters.
Our approach is has 233 steps.
The first step is to use a geometric filtering in order to generate multiple abstraction level.
After that, for each abstraction level we apply robust perceptual technique called tensor voting in order to estimate the homogenity.
After that we construct a graph and we run fast graph based segmenter.
In this case we we use the proposed by Physical Sense Qualifier Locker in 2004, that is a region growing.
Segment.
This is our results.
This is an example.
The first image is a set of pixels with depth information.
That is, that is the the input Alpha of our algorithm.
Our result is the second one that is censored based option an in order to compare our solution, we developed the same the same algorithm but based in vector.
And you can see that answer based approach outperformed vector based.
We proved with outdoor and indoor scenes and the results obtained were similar.
The performance highly depends on the distance from the camera.
The new method produces very good results for near regions we were working with the distance from 1 meter to 5 meters.
So if the region is centered at three meters or less, the results are very very very good.
But for regions that are farther than 3 meters, the algorithm starts to go a little bit worse.
But it is driven by the big hike amount of noise present in the 3D matches.
So for more details of all the tensor voting things and all the details, I hope to see you in the poster session.
